Hey Michael,

An associate and I are trying to replace Chemkin calls, withi=
n a
developed Fortran code, with Cantera calls through the demo_lib.cpp
int=
erface as a guide.  We have been having some trouble with the
meanmolarmass=
() call.  Sometimes it will work and other times it will
not.  (When it wil=
l not work, the code will return a segmentation
fault within our Fortran co=
de when the value returned is printed out).
 We are guessing at this point =
that there is some conflict that we
have not found yet that makes this call=
 work intermittently.  It does
work at points in our code though, and so we=
 think that this is a
coding issue on our side and not a Cantera issue.  

=
Dan Smyth


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Michael Johnson <johns3c@...> w=
rote:
>
> Dear Cantera group,
> 
> I am working on channel-flow simulations=
 with DASSL, coupled to Cantera.
> The command meanmolarmass() returns a va=
lue of 0.0000E+00 but if I take 
> the ratio of, say, cp_mole()/cp_mass() i=
t does return the proper value.
> 
> I'm running on Linux, using the demo_f=
tnlib.cpp provided with the
source 
> code. I have looked through the heade=
r files under 
> /usr/local/include/cantera but have been unable to find wh=
ere 
> meanMolecularWeight() is defined. It is certainly used to calculate =

> molar properties with no problem, but I can't figure out why 
> meanmola=
rmass() is not giving the proper value.
> 
> Is anyone out there using Cant=
era in Fortran?
> Thanks,
> Michael
>
